title: Commutative Property of Multiplication
text: The commutative property of multiplication states that if a, $$b$$ are real numbers, then $$a b=b a$$.
speech: The commutative property of multiplication states that if a,  b  are real numbers, then  a b, is equal to b a .
pacedSpeech: The commutative property of multiplication states that if a,   b
are real numbers, then   a b, is equal to b a

title: Re-ordering
text: Using the commutative property of multiplication on the last two terms, we can reorder the expression as $$\frac{3}{20} \frac{20}{3} \frac{49}{11}$$.
speech: Using the commutative property of multiplication on the last two terms, we can reorder the expression as , 3 over 20, 20 over 3, 49 over 11 .
pacedSpeech: Using the commutative property of multiplication on the last two terms, we can reorder the expression as  , 3 over 20, 20 over 3, 49 over 11

title: Multiplication
text: Since $$\frac{3}{20}$$ and $$\frac{20}{3}$$ are reciprocal of each other, and a number and its reciprocal multiply to one, $$\frac{3}{20} \frac{20}{3}=1$$.
speech: Since  3 over 20,  and  20 over 3,  are reciprocal of each other, and a number and its reciprocal multiply to one, , 3 over 20, 20 over 3 is equal to 1 .
pacedSpeech: are reciprocal of each other, and a number and its reciprocal multiply to one,  , 3 over 20, 20 over 3 is equal to 1

title: Multiplication
text: The expression turns into $$1\frac{49}{11}$$. What is this value?
